result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared M Owens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: On or Near a School], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: on or near Certain Places], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 13CF367, 14CF143 & 14CF155 called at 9:37 am  (Clerk SF to 9:54am, MK from 9:54am to end)
Defendant Jared M Owens in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Lunchsinger informs the Court that there is no resolution on case 14CF143.
On case 14CF155 the Court makes record of side bar conducted that the 9/25/14 Jury Trial.

On 13CF367, Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Owens to:
--serve 90 days in Jefferson County Jail, TIME SERVED SENTENCE  
--90 days credit for time already served given
--to provide DNA sample upon request
--pay costs of $268, $250 DNA Surcharge plus $50 drug testing fees; apply the $300 cash bail amount; the balance is to be paid  in $50 per month installments beginning on 11/1/14 and on the first day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in entry of a civil judgment for the amount due

-----------------------------------------

On Case #14CF155, Counts #1, #2, #4 and #5, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Owens on Probation for three years
On Case #14CF 155, Count #3, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Owens on Probation for two years with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment and counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--to undergo drug testing; no less than two times per month for the first year of Probation, and thereafter random testing as the Agent deems appropriate
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent, and except for indicental contact for educational or employment purposes as deemed appropriate by the Agent
-- on Count #2 only:  to perform 100 hours of Community Service
---to comply with DNA sample provision
--on Count #1: to pay cost of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $200 drug testing fees
--on Count #2: to pay cost of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--on Count #3: to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge
--on Count #4: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--on Count #5: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served given in Case #14CF155:  2 days 
Apply $100 cash bail toward payment of financial obligations 

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
recess 10:25am.
Sentencing hearing on October 7, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 8:37am. 
Defendant Jared M Owens in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.   
The Court addresses procedural matters related to trial: 
--Attorney Luchsinger indicates that the Defense is stipulating that Mr. Owens has a prior offense; this does not need to be proven at trial.
--after hearing arguments on Defense prejudice assertions related to the evidence being presented on the underlying felony case related to the Bailjumping charge, the Court finds that severance of the counts is not needed; a cautionary instruction will be given on this.
--ADA Teuber addresses the State's Witness List, informing the Court and Defense that citizen witnesses Barbara Hein and Denise Kubiak will both testify that they have been convicted of forfeiture citations related to this same incident. 
--ADA Teuber renews the State's jury nullifcation concerns raised at the recent trial in Mr. Owens case #13CF367.
--ADA Teuber motions to preclude the Defense from any reference to the Defendant's statements and Defendant's testimony unless there is an absolute determination that Mr. Owens will testify.
Recess 8:57am, Reconvene 9:06am with potential jurors in the courtroom.

Jury Selection:
--oath given to the array of jurors
--Voir dire by the Court: Juror #1529 excused for cause; Jurors #2212 and #907 are excused.
--Voir dire by ADA Teuber
--recess 9:53am, reconvene 9:59am.
--Individual Voir dire held: Juror #894 and #1076 excused for cause
--Voir dire by Attorney Luchsinger
Juror selected and sworn: (1) Juror #2184, (2) Juror #1404, (3) Juror #730, (4) Juror #94, (5) Juror #852, (6) Juror #666, (7) Juror #1492, (8) Juror #943, 
(9) Juror #578, (10) Juror #809, (11) Juror #1088, (12) Juror #1858. 
Recess 11:03am, Reconvene 11:14am; Jury enters.

Opening Statement given by ADA Teuber. 

Cindy Hamre-Incha- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--State's Exhibit #1 & #2
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
--redirect examination by ADA Teuber

Detective Chad Handrow- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--State's Exhibit #3 & #4 #5 & #6 & #7
--State's Exhibit #10, #11
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
--redirect examination by ADA Teuber
--recross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
Recess 12:48pm, reconvene 1:24pm. Jury enters

James Hein -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger

Jury exits at 1:42pm for voir dire of the witnesses on Court's own 
-------James Hein- testifies, still under oath
         --examination by the Court
         --examination by Attorney Luchsinger
         --examination by ADA Teuber
-------Denise Kubiak- sworn & testifies
         --examination by Attorney Luchsinger
         --examination by ADA Teuber
-------Barbara Hein- sworn & testifies
         --examination by Attorney Luchsinger
         --examination by ADA Teuber

Jury enters at 2:02pm.
James Hein- continues testimony, still under oath
--continuation of cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger

Denise Kubiak- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--State's Exhibits #12, #13
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
--redirect examination by ADA Teuber

Barbara Hein- sworn & testifies 
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--State's Exhibit #8
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
--redirect examination by ADA Teuber

Lab Analyst Kenneth B. Olson- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Teuber
--State's Exhibit #9
--cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
Jury exits at 3:13pm to allow time for State to have the evidence officer obtain an item in secure storage.
The Court reviews with Mr. Owens his right to testify/not to testify.  Mr. Owens chooses not to testify.
ADA Teuber motions to amend the charging language in Count #3 to indicate that the item was used to store, contain or conceal a controlled substance.
After hearing arguments, the Court grants the Motion. 
Jury Instruction Conference (3:22-3:34pm)
The Court receives the stipulation of the parties that Denise Kubiak's statement to Detective Leffler on May 6, 2014 was that she, Denise Kubiak, only smoked marijuana with her mother.  
Jury enters at 3:49pm.

Lab Analyst Kenneth B. Olson- resumes stand, still under oath
--continuation of cross examination by Attorney Luchsinger
--State's Exhibits #14, #11
--redirect examination by ADA Teuber
The stipulation is read to the Jury. 
State rests, Defense rests.
Evidence closed at 3:54pm.
 
Closing arguments given by ADA Teuber (3-56pm-4:05pm)
Closing arguments given by Attorney Luchsinger (4:05pm-4:20pm)
Rebuttal Closing arguments given by ADA  (4:20pm-4:24pm)
The Court instructs the Jury (4:25pm-4:48pm)
Deputy M. Kanters is sworn as the Jury Bailiff.
The Jury retires to deliberate at 4:50pm.

5:34pm: Jury returns with its Verdict.
The Jury finds Mr. Owens guilty of Count #1, Delivery of THC, and that this occurred within 1000 feet of a school 
The Jury finds Mr. Owens guilty of Count #2, Possession of THC, 2nd+ Offense
The Jury finds Mr. Owens guilty of Count #3, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia
The Jury finds Mr. Owens guilty of Count #4, Felony Bailjumping
The Jury finds Mr. Owens guilty of Count #5, Felony Bailjumping.

The Court polls the Jury; their responses confirm the written verdict form.
The Court excuses the Jury. The Jury exits at 5:38am.
The Court receives the Verdicts, finds Mr. Owens Guilty of Counts #1, #2, #3, #4, and #5,  and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
ADA Teuber Motions for the Court to Revoke Bond. Arguments given by counsel. 
The Court denies the Motion. The Court continues the Bond, reminding Mr. Owens to follow the conditions of Bond.
recess 5:46pm

NEXT:  schedule Sentencing Hearing on 9/30/14 at 9:30am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 2:09pm. 
Defendant Jared M Owens in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Luchsinger indicates that there is no resolution in this case. 
The Court finds that there are two prior convictions for impeachment purposes.
In response to Court indicating that no proposed jury instructions have been filed, Attorney Luchsinger indicates that he anticipates being in agreement with the State's proposed jury instructions. The Court indicates to ADA Teuber that she only needs to file proposed substantive instructions. 
ADA Teuber indicates that the State's witnesses include: three citizen witnesses, a Deputy Clerk of Court, four police officers, and and an analyst from the State Crime Lab.  The State is in the #2 position for the lab analyst on Thursday (9/25/14) and the State is in the #1 position for Mr. Owen's other Jury Trial case #14CF143 which is set for Friday (9/26/14). 
ADA Teuber indicates that there are numerous photos and a video to display; she will work with the clerk to arrange for video-testing.  ADA Teuber indicates there will be controlled substances presented as evidence; the controlled substances will be maintained in the control of law enforcement. 
The Court gives Attorney Luchsinger notice that the Court will not allow certain voir dire questions and certain statements such as the Defense made in the recent Jury Trial in a different case Mr. Owen's has.  
The Court indicates that any resolution of this case should be put on the record by noon on Wednesday . 
The Court intends to have an additional juror; each party will have five strikes during jury selection. 
After discussion with counsel, the Court removes the 9/22/14 FSSC in Case #14CF143 from its calendar because it is not needed; the Jury Trial in case #14CF143 remains on the calendar for next Friday. 
recess 2:21pm. 

NEXT:  Jury Trial on September 25, 2014 at 8:30am; the jurors are to prepared for jury selection at 8:45am.
Final status/scheduling conference on September 19, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial on September 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cases 13CF367 & 14CF155 called together at 2:16 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jared M Owens in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger. ADA Jeffrey M Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews that It has signed stipulation to adjourn in case 13CF367
Atty Luchsinger: Requests cases continue to track together; demand speedy trial in each case - 1 day needed for trial in each case. 
Court informs parties that It will schedule 13CF367 first for trial, then 14CF155
Court informs Atty Luchsinger that he should submit order re: suppression motion

NEXT:  BOTH CASES: (1) Schedule for FSSC & JT - Send notices (WITHIN 90 DAYS)
Status conference on July 7, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 10:06am.
Defendant Jared M Owens in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Owens waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess 10:10am. 

NEXT:  schedule Status Conference on 7/7/14 at 2:00pm (when Mr. Owens has a FSSC set in another pending case)
A copy of the cash bond posted w/attached note from the jail & COC ref unable to locate the original
Request by the defendant to refund the bond to the surety is denied, Surety may make the request per 969.14
Notice of hearing for JCJ - sent to DAs Office, returned to Clerk's Office - Copy made and forwarded to the jail
from Def. re: request to return cash bond to surety
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 4, 2014 at 02:20 pm.

cases #13CF367, #14CF143, and #14CF155 called at 10:05am. (separate minutes for each case) 
Defendant Jared M Owens in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J Luchsinger.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
[The Court conducts Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment in case #14CF143.]
The Court and counsel discuss scheduling.
recess 10:31am. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 6/4/14 at 2:20pm  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing
Status conference on May 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 21, 2014 at 10:20 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Jared M Owens
Current: 516 E. Main St #224, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 05-08-2014)
Prior: 814 Cole Street, Watertown, WI 53094

Case called at 1:22 pm.  

Defendant Jared M Owens in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Steven Luchsinger. Attorney Luchsinger informs the Court that he was appointed by the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB on the criminal complaint is correct. 
Attorney Luchsinger informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.

Court requires $100 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Not to possess or ingest any controlled substances or paraphernalia for controlled substances
-No presence at 814 Cole Street, Watertown. Mr. Owen may return one time with law enforcement to retrieve his belongings 
-Notify COC for changes of address within 48 hours from the time he learns of his new address
-No contact with Barbara Hein, James Hein, and Denise Kubiak 

Recess: 

NEXT: 
PTC- 05-21-14 10:20 am
Schedule Preliminary Hearing after PTC
